title: Bug 113047: No children node listing when changing data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab.
OB: When changing the data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed. The current data source's children are not displayed.
EB: The children nodes should be listed when changing the data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab. The new data source's children should be displayed.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new dataset without an SQL statement. 2. In the dataset editor, navigate to the data source page. 3. Change the data source. The new data source should have database/table/column information. Actual result: No children nodes are listed when changing the data source for a dataset in the dataset editor page of the query tab. Close the dataset editor and reopen it to confirm.
